subject: Entrepreneurship
title: The Wizard of Oz MVP
description: Learn The Wizard of Oz MVP in one minute.

hook.text: Zappos founder Nick Swinmurn had a wild idea: sell shoes online. Nobody believed it could work.

buildup.text: Instead of building a warehouse, he photographed shoes at local stores and posted them online.

discovery.text: When someone ordered, he ran to the store, bought the shoes at full price, and shipped them himself.

twist.text: Customers thought they were buying from a real online retailer. Behind the curtain: one guy running.

climax.text: Swinmurn proved demand before investing in inventory. Amazon later bought Zappos for $1.2 billion.

punchline.text: Fake the backend. Validate the frontend.

quiz.question: What makes a Wizard of Oz MVP different from a concierge MVP?
options: The Wizard of Oz MVP is fully automated from the start
Customers don't know the process is manualâ€”it looks automated from the outside
It requires building a complete prototype before testing
